member.summary: Initiates the process of either authenticating (redirecting to a login page) or obtaining and supplying a token to the ArcGIS IdentityManager.
member.param: The OAuth2 error if there is one (eg. "access_denied" - indicates the user cancelled).
member.returns: true if an OAuth implicit grant token is present; otherwise false, in which case a redirect to a login page will be performed.

member.summary: Constructs a default
member.param: The name of the field that this category is attached to

member.summary: Raises the PropertyChanged event with the provided arguments.
member.param: The name of the property that has changed.

member.name: P:Geocortex.Essentials.Client.Charting.ChartCategoryDefinition.Field
member.summary: Gets the that will be used for generating this Category
member.remarks: This field object also contains all of the formatting information for this Category. This should probably be moved into since it has more to do with translating a feature/featureset into a Category, but it will remain here for now. Right now the field contains the formatting information in conjuction with the fieldname itself. This information is used when creating the used by the actual Geocortex Chart in infrastructure. I would like to see the formatting information be kept in this class and move the field configuration into the FeatureLayerChart since it is more feature / layer specific information that the Infrastructural chart shouldn't have to worry about.

member.name: P:Geocortex.Essentials.Client.Charting.ChartSeriesDefinition.Field
member.summary: Gets the that will be used for generating this Series of data
member.remarks: This field object also contains all of the formatting information for this series. This should probably be moved into feature chart since it has more to do with translating a feature/featureset into a Series, but it will remain here for now. Right now the field contains the formatting information in conjuction with the fieldname itself. This information is used when creating the used by the actual Geocortex Chart in infrastructure. I would like to see the formatting information be kept in this class and move the field configuration into the FeatureLayerChart since it is more feature / layer specific information that the Infrastructural chart shouldn't have to worry about.

member.name: P:Geocortex.Essentials.Client.Charting.ChartSeriesDefinition.ValueAggregatorName
member.summary: Gets or sets the name of the Value Aggregator to be used by this series. See remarks.
member.remarks: In infrastructure, there is a notion of an IValueAggregator which is responsible for aggregating value fields in collections that are generated by the Series Definition. The IValueAggregators are imported allowing a developer to create a new one and configure any chart to use it by its name.

member.name: T:Geocortex.Essentials.Client.Charting.LayerChartConfig
member.summary: A Chart defined for FeatureLayers. This allows charts to be configured with special layer specific properties that the Infrastructural chart shouldn't be concerned with.
member.remarks: This should allow us to support sub charts at a later date that could be used to define chart configuration for drill down charts and other such things. Also should allow specifying a region for the chart to live in, perhaps? We just want to try and separate the display configuration from the logical configuration (i.e. fields on features, datalinks etc)

member.name: M:Geocortex.Essentials.Client.Tasks.FeatureEditing.EditableFeatureBase.#ctor(Geocortex.Essentials.Client.Tasks.Feature)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class. An EditableFeature is a viewmodel of a Feature that also exposes the feature attributes as viewmodels which can be bound to. This is useful for things such as editing where we want to update attribute values. If the attribute values exist on an Esri Graphic and are editable, and that graphic has a layer which is also editable, then changed attributes can be saved back to the server.
member.exception: throws ArgumentNullException if feature is null.
throws ArgumentException if feature.EsriFeature is null, or if the feature doesn't have linked attributes from an Esri Graphic.

member.name: T:Geocortex.Essentials.Client.AsyncInitializableCollection`1
member.summary: Abstract base class for a collection of objects that is initialized asynchronously from a REST endpoint.

remarks.para: Provides methods, events and properties that are common to all collection classes that get their initialization data from a REST endpoint.
This is the sequence of an asynchronous initialization:

list.item: The subclass asynchronously calls a REST endpoint typically using a WebClient.
Once the asynchronous call has completed, sets the IsInitialized property to true.
If the asynchronous call returned an error, sets the InitializationFailure property to the exception and fires the InitializationFailed event.
Fires the Initialized event, regardless of whether there were errors.

member.typeparam: Any class that can be initialized asynchronously.

member.name: T:Geocortex.Essentials.Client.IAsyncInitializable
member.summary: Interface for classes that are initialized asynchronously.
member.remarks: It is recommended that you use the AsyncInitializable and AsyncInitializableCollection base classes instead, as they provide additional functionality.

member.summary: Occurs when an asynchronous Initialize operation completes.

member.summary: Occurs when an asynchronous Initialize operation ends in failure.

member.summary: Gets the initialization exception if the initialization failed.

remarks.para: Web maps can contain layers from ArcGIS Server map, image and feature services, KML documents, and OGC web services. You can also import data you have stored in comma-separated values table (.csv or .txt) or a GPS Exchange format (.gpx) file. When creating the web map you can create and define popup content, set a basemap and specify the intial extent.

member.name: M:Geocortex.Client.CompositeExtensions.Flatten``1(Geocortex.Client.IComposite{``0},System.Predicate{``0},Geocortex.Client.TraversalOrder,System.Predicate{``0})
member.summary: Transforms a tree into a flat list. In order for the tree to be recursable, a branch node must implement IComposite<T>.
member.typeparam: The type of the items in the tree.
member.param: The optional predicate which items must satisfy to be included in the final list. If no condition is specified, then all items are added to the result.
The traversal order to use when flattening the tree. This will ipmpact the order of the items in the returned list.
A condition for evaluation of children nodes.
member.returns: A list with all items in the tree added to it, in an order commensurate with the specified traversal order.

member.name: M:Geocortex.Client.CompositeExtensions.Flatten``1(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{``0},System.Predicate{``0},Geocortex.Client.TraversalOrder,System.Predicate{``0})
member.summary: Transforms a tree into a flat list. In order for the tree to be recursable, a branch node must implement IComposite<T>.
member.typeparam: The type of the items in the tree.
member.param: The optional predicate which items must satisfy to be included in the final list. If no condition is specified, then all items are added to the result.
The traversal order to use when flattening the tree. This will impact the order of the items in the returned list.
A condition for evaluation of children nodes.
member.returns: A list with all items in the tree added to it, in an order commensurate with the specified traversal order.

member.summary: A flavour of depth-first traversal where the parent nodes are visited before the child nodes, and the left nodes are visited before the right nodes.

member.name: M:Geocortex.Essentials.Client.MapService.CreateFrom(ESRI.ArcGIS.Client.Layer,System.Object)

summary.para: This method is not intended for use in your code without significant guidance.
Creates a map service from a live service layer along with additional information.

member.param: The dynamic element containing additional properties to assign during map service creation.

remarks.para: The resulting MapService is formed by aggregating knowledge from the working service layer and an arbitrary structure passed in by the dynamic element. The dynamic element implementation may be satisfied by any object, but AutoExpandoObject will provide better support.
Refer to code gallery for more details.

summary.para: Sets the visibility of a set of layers. If the service is tiled or image, the visible parameter is applied to the whole service.
The count of the two list parameters must be identical, and the layer id and corresponding visibility are matched up based on the list item's index.

member.name: P:Geocortex.Essentials.Client.MapService.InActiveThemeOrNoThemes
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the service is either in the active layer theme, or there are no themes. This is useful because when determining if a service should be participating in a theme, the check is normally only relevant if themes are available. By using this property instead of InActiveTheme, it covers off the case where there simply are no themes.

member.name: T:Geocortex.Essentials.Client.Ows.WmtsLayer
member.summary: A layer that conforms to the Web Map Tiling Service (WMTS) Open GIS Consortium (OGC) standard. WMTS is a cached service that accesses pre-created tiles from a cache on a server’s hard drive instead of dynamically rendering images.

remarks.para: The full WMTS standard can be found on the OpenGIS Web Map Tile Service Implementation Standard web page. As of ArcGIS Server version 10.1 serving WMTS layers as a native REST service is supported.
In order to consume a WmtsLayer successfully the following Properties must be set:
There are however several other optional Properties/Methods/Events that should also be set in order to avoid problems consuming a WmtsLayer, they are:

list.item: Initialized Method (Method raised when WmtsLayer is being created on the client; useful to get or change information about the layer.)
InitializationFailed Event (Method raised if the WmtsLayer has a problem being created.)
ProxyUrl Property (A proxy service to broker web requests between the WMTS service and the web client.)
Layer Property (Name of a single layer in a WMTS service; there can be multiple layers per service.)
ID Property (The unique ID of the layer in the Map control.)

remarks.para: A single WMTS service can have multiple layers. For each WmtsLayer instance, only one layer is drawn at a time. In order to discover what layers are available in a WMTS service, append the string '?request=GetCapabilities&service=WMTS&version=1.0.0' to what would be supplied for the WmtsLayer.Url Property in the address bar of a web browser and the full details will be provided in an XML document. A few example strings of obtaining the capabilities of a WMTS service are:

By default if the WmtsLayer.Layer Property is not specified, the first layer respecting the WmtsLayer.TileMatrixSet will be used. When specifying the WmtsLayer.Layer Property at runtime in the code-behind, the WmtsLayer’s Refresh Method fires which in turn invokes the WmtsLayer’s Initialized Event which will cause a re-draw of the layer in the Map Control.

It is important to specify the correct WmtsLayer.WmtsServiceMode Enumeration in the WmtsLayer.ServiceMode Property or the WmtsLayer may not be created properly. The two available WmtsLayer.WmtsServiceMode Enumeration options available are KVP and RESTful. WMTS services provided by ArcGIS Server produce RESTful WmtsLayer.WmtsServiceMode services. The KVP WmtsLayer.WmtsServiceMode means HTTP 'Key/Value Pair' encoding; details on this OGC specification can found by downloading the WCS Extension -- KVP Protocol document.

A call to the WmtsLayer is Asynchronous. As a result, this means that you cannot obtain valid Read (VB.NET) or get (C#) Property values until information has been returned from a WMTS server to the Client application. You can safely obtain valid Read/get Property information in the Initialized, PropertyChanged, TileLoaded, and TileLoading Events or from a function/sub/method that occurs after these Events fire. If you try to obtain Read/get Property information before these Events fire you will obtain invalid or null/Nothing information for the particular Property in question.

example.para: Select a layer name in the ListBox and click the 'Get WMTSLayer information' button to display various WMTSLayer and WMTSLayer.LayerInfo Property information. The Map will automatically zoom to the Extent of the layer. Properties with the words '[Count]' gives the count of the number of items in an IEnumerable; more coding could be done in the code-behind to dig deeper into the collection.
The XAML code in this example is used in conjunction with the code-behind (C# or VB.NET) to demonstrate the functionality.
The following screen shot corresponds to the code example in this page.

img.alt: Example of displaying a WmtsLayer and detailed information about the service.

example.code:
<Grid x:Name="LayoutRoot" Background="White">
<!-- Add a Map Control. --> <esri:Map Background="White" HorizontalAlignment="Left" Name="Map1" VerticalAlignment="Top" WrapAround="True" Height="400" Width="775" Margin="12,80,0,0"> <esri:Map.Layers> <esri:LayerCollection>
<!-- Add a sample WmtsLayer. Setting the 'ID' Property is good if you want to access the WmtsLayer in code-behind. It is mandatory that you set the correct 'ServiceMode' Property. Setting the 'InitializationFailed' Event is useful to troubleshoot if the WmtsLayer fails to load. A 'ProxyUrl' is needed to test this particular service; it is not always necessary depending on your configuration (i.e. local web service internal to your network). Use the 'Initialized' Method to gain access to various Properties/Methods of the WmtsLayer. --> <esri:WmtsLayer ID="WMTS1" Url="http://v2.suite.opengeo.org/geoserver/gwc/service/wmts" Initialized="WmtsLayer_Initialized" ProxyUrl="http://serverapps.esri.com/SilverlightDemos/ProxyPage/proxy.ashx" InitializationFailed="WmtsLayer_InitializationFailed" ServiceMode="KVP" /> </esri:LayerCollection> </esri:Map.Layers> </esri:Map>
<!-- Add a Button to allow the user to change the sub-Layer that is displaying in the Map along with information about the WmtsLayer service. --> <Button Content="Get WMTSLayer information" Height="23" HorizontalAlignment="Left" Margin="518,484,0,0" Name="Button1" VerticalAlignment="Top" Width="269" Click="Button1_Click"/> <ListBox Height="103" HorizontalAlignment="Left" Margin="519,513,0,0" Name="ListBox1" VerticalAlignment="Top" Width="269" />
<!-- Display various WMTSLayer Property information. --> <sdk:Label Height="28" HorizontalAlignment="Left" Margin="170,479,0,0" Name="Label_WMTSLayerProperties" VerticalAlignment="Top" Width="199" Content="WMTSLayer Properties" FontSize="14" FontWeight="Bold"/>
<!-- FullExtent--> <sdk:Label Height="28" HorizontalAlignment="Left" Margin="7,508,0,0" Name="Label_FullExtent" VerticalAlignment="Top" Width="120" Content="FullExtent:" /> <TextBox Height="23" HorizontalAlignment="Left" Margin="101,508,0,0" Name="TextBox_FullExtent" VerticalAlignment="Top" Width="400" />
<!--Description--> <sdk:Label Height="28" HorizontalAlignment="Left" Margin="7,540,0,0" Name="Label_Description" VerticalAlignment="Top" Width="88" Content="Description:"/> <TextBox Height="23" HorizontalAlignment="Left" Margin="101,536,0,0" Name="TextBox_Description" VerticalAlignment="Top" Width="400" />
<!--ImageFormat--> <sdk:Label Height="28" HorizontalAlignment="Left" Margin="7,569,0,0" Name="Label_ImageFormat" VerticalAlignment="Top" Width="88" Content="ImageFormat:"/> <TextBox Height="23" HorizontalAlignment="Left" Margin="101,565,0,0" Name="TextBox_ImageFormat" VerticalAlignment="Top" Width="161" />
<!--Layer--> <sdk:Label Height="28" HorizontalAlignment="Left" Margin="268,565,0,0" Name="Label_Layer" VerticalAlignment="Top" Width="88" Content="Layer:"/> <TextBox Height="23" HorizontalAlignment="Left" Margin="309,565,0,0" Name="TextBox_Layer" VerticalAlignment="Top" Width="192" />
<!--LayerInfos--> <sdk:Label Height="28" HorizontalAlignment="Left" Margin="7,596,0,0" Name="Label_LayerInfos" VerticalAlignment="Top" Width="140" Content="LayerInfos [Count]:"/> <TextBox Height="23" HorizontalAlignment="Left" Margin="119,593,0,0" Name="TextBox_LayerInfos" VerticalAlignment="Top" Width="89" />
<!--ProxyUrl--> <sdk:Label Height="28" HorizontalAlignment="Left" Margin="7,625,0,0" Name="Label_ProxyUrl" VerticalAlignment="Top" Width="88" Content="ProxyUrl:"/> <TextBox Height="23" HorizontalAlignment="Left" Margin="101,622,0,0" Name="TextBox_ProxyUrl" VerticalAlignment="Top" Width="400" />
<!-- ServiceMode--> <sdk:Label Height="28" HorizontalAlignment="Left" Margin="225,597,0,0" Name="Label_ServiceMode" VerticalAlignment="Top" Width="88" Content="ServiceMode:"/> <TextBox Height="23" HorizontalAlignment="Left" Margin="309,593,0,0" Name="TextBox_ServiceMode" VerticalAlignment="Top" Width="192" />
<!--Style--> <sdk:Label Height="28" HorizontalAlignment="Left" Margin="7,650,0,0" Name="Label_Style" VerticalAlignment="Top" Width="88" Content="Style:"/> <TextBox Height="23" HorizontalAlignment="Left" Margin="101,650,0,0" Name="TextBox_Style" VerticalAlignment="Top" Width="161" />
<!--TileMatrixSet--> <sdk:Label Height="28" HorizontalAlignment="Left" Margin="268,654,0,0" Name="Label_TileMatrixSet" VerticalAlignment="Top" Width="88" Content="TileMatrixSet:"/> <TextBox Height="23" HorizontalAlignment="Left" Margin="352,654,0,0" Name="TextBox_TileMatrixSet" VerticalAlignment="Top" Width="149" />
<!--Title--> <sdk:Label Height="28" HorizontalAlignment="Left" Margin="7,688,0,0" Name="Label_Title" VerticalAlignment="Top" Width="120" Content="Title:"/> <TextBox Height="23" HorizontalAlignment="Left" Margin="101,684,0,0" Name="TextBox_Title" VerticalAlignment="Top" Width="400" />
<!--Token--> <sdk:Label Height="28" HorizontalAlignment="Left" Margin="7,717,0,0" Name="Label_Token" VerticalAlignment="Top" Width="120" Content="Token:"/> <TextBox Height="23" HorizontalAlignment="Left" Margin="101,713,0,0" Name="TextBox_Token" VerticalAlignment="Top" Width="400" />
<!--Url--> <sdk:Label Height="28" HorizontalAlignment="Left" Margin="7,746,0,0" Name="Label_Url" VerticalAlignment="Top" Width="120" Content="Url:"/> <TextBox Height="23" HorizontalAlignment="Left" Margin="101,742,0,0" Name="TextBox_Url" VerticalAlignment="Top" Width="400" />
<!--Version--> <sdk:Label Height="28" HorizontalAlignment="Left" Margin="7,775,0,0" Name="Label_Version" VerticalAlignment="Top" Width="120" Content="Version:"/> <TextBox Height="23" HorizontalAlignment="Left" Margin="101,771,0,0" Name="TextBox_Version" VerticalAlignment="Top" Width="400" />
<!--Display detailed WMTSLayer.LayerInfo about the specific sub-Layer that is being displayed. --> <sdk:Label Height="28" HorizontalAlignment="Left" Margin="543,622,0,0" Name="Label_WMTSLayerLayerInfo" VerticalAlignment="Top" Width="187" Content="WMTSLayer.LayerInfo" FontSize="14" FontWeight="Bold" />
<!--Abstract--> <sdk:Label Height="28" HorizontalAlignment="Left" Margin="511,656,0,0" Name="Label_Abstract" VerticalAlignment="Top" Width="50" Content="Abstract:"/> <TextBox Height="23" HorizontalAlignment="Left" Margin="569,652,0,0" Name="TextBox_Abstract" VerticalAlignment="Top" Width="67" />

</Grid>

Private Sub Button1_Click(ByVal sender As System.Object, ByVal e As System.Windows.RoutedEventArgs)
' This function takes the user choice for a specific WmtsLayer.Layer from a ListBox and refreshes ' the Map using that layer.
' Get the user choice for the name of the WmtsLayer.Layer. Dim theTitle As String = ListBox1.SelectedItem.ToString
' Get the WmtsLayer that was defined in XAML. Dim theWMTSLayer As ESRI.ArcGIS.Client.Toolkit.DataSources.WmtsLayer = Map1.Layers("WMTS1")
' Set the specific layer to display in the WmtsLayer. This will internally cause a WmtsLayer.Refresh ' which in turn causes the WmtsLayer.Initialized Method to execute. theWMTSLayer.Layer = theTitle
End Sub
Private Sub WmtsLayer_Initialized(ByVal sender As System.Object, ByVal e As System.EventArgs)
' This function loops through all of the sub-Layers in a WmtsLayer service and displays information ' about the WmtsLayer service in general and details about a particular WmtsLayer.Layer specified ' by the user choice. This function initiates whenever the WmtsLayer first initializes or as a result ' of specifying a different WmtsLayer.Layer.
' Clear out all of the sub-Layer names of the WmtsLayer service. ListBox1.Items.Clear()
' Get the WmtsLayer that was defined in XAML. Dim theWMTSLayer As ESRI.ArcGIS.Client.Toolkit.DataSources.WmtsLayer = Map1.Layers("WMTS1")
' Get all of the sub-Layer information from the WmtsLayer. Dim theLayers As IEnumerable(Of ESRI.ArcGIS.Client.Toolkit.DataSources.WmtsLayer.WmtsLayerInfo) = theWMTSLayer.LayerInfos If theLayers IsNot Nothing Then For Each oneWMTSLayerInfo As ESRI.ArcGIS.Client.Toolkit.DataSources.WmtsLayer.WmtsLayerInfo In theLayers 'Display the name of the WmtsLayer sub-Layer's in the ListBox. ListBox1.Items.Add(oneWMTSLayerInfo.Title) Next End If
' Set the Map.Extent to the WmtsLayer sub-Layer and display the numerical extent in a TextBox. If theWMTSLayer.FullExtent IsNot Nothing Then Map1.Extent = theWMTSLayer.FullExtent TextBox_FullExtent.Text = theWMTSLayer.FullExtent.ToString End If
' Display the Description of the WmtsLayer service. If theWMTSLayer.Description IsNot Nothing Then TextBox_Description.Text = theWMTSLayer.Description End If
' Display the ImageFormat of the WmtsLayer service. If theWMTSLayer.ImageFormat IsNot Nothing Then TextBox_ImageFormat.Text = theWMTSLayer.ImageFormat End If
' Display the currently displaying sub-Layer name of the WmtsLayer service. If theWMTSLayer.Layer IsNot Nothing Then TextBox_Layer.Text = theWMTSLayer.Layer End If
' Display the LayerInfos.Count of the WmtsLayer service. More information is available if you ' care to loop through the IEnumerable(Of WmtsLayer.WmtsLayerInfo) objects. If theWMTSLayer.LayerInfos IsNot Nothing Then TextBox_LayerInfos.Text = theWMTSLayer.LayerInfos.Count.ToString End If
' Display the ProxyUrl of the WmtsLayer service. If theWMTSLayer.ProxyUrl IsNot Nothing Then TextBox_ProxyUrl.Text = theWMTSLayer.ProxyUrl End If
' Display the ServiceMode Enumeration of the WmtsLayer service. TextBox_ServiceMode.Text = theWMTSLayer.ServiceMode.ToString 'An Enumeration.
' Display the Style of the WmtsLayer service. If theWMTSLayer.Style IsNot Nothing Then TextBox_Style.Text = theWMTSLayer.Style End If
' Display the TileMatrix of the WmtsLayer service. If theWMTSLayer.TileMatrixSet IsNot Nothing Then TextBox_TileMatrixSet.Text = theWMTSLayer.TileMatrixSet End If
' Display the Title of the WmtsLayer service. Select the name of the Title in the ListBox to ' show which sub-Layer is currently being displayed in the Map. If theWMTSLayer.Title IsNot Nothing Then TextBox_Title.Text = theWMTSLayer.Title ListBox1.SelectedItem = theWMTSLayer.Title End If
' Display the Token of the WmtsLayer service. If theWMTSLayer.Token IsNot Nothing Then TextBox_Token.Text = theWMTSLayer.Token End If
' Display the Url of the WmtsLayer service. If theWMTSLayer.Url IsNot Nothing Then TextBox_Url.Text = theWMTSLayer.Url End If
' Display the Version of the WmtsLayer service. If theWMTSLayer.Version IsNot Nothing Then TextBox_Version.Text = theWMTSLayer.Version End If
' Get the WmtsLayer.Title from the user choice in the ListBox. This will be used to display detailed ' information (WmtsLayer.WmtsLayerInfo) about the specific WmtsLayer.Layer currently being shown in the map. Dim theTitle As String = Nothing If ListBox1.SelectedItem IsNot Nothing Then theTitle = ListBox1.SelectedItem.ToString End If
' Loop through all of the sub-Layers of the WmtsLayer and display WmtsLayer.WmtsLayerInfo Property ' information that match the user choice in the ListBox. If theLayers IsNot Nothing Then For Each oneWMTSLayerInfo As ESRI.ArcGIS.Client.Toolkit.DataSources.WmtsLayer.WmtsLayerInfo In theLayers If oneWMTSLayerInfo.Title = theTitle Then
' Display the Abstract of the WmtsLayer.WmtsLayerInfo sub-Layer. If oneWMTSLayerInfo.Abstract IsNot Nothing Then TextBox_Abstract.Text = oneWMTSLayerInfo.Abstract End If
' Display the Formats of the WmtsLayer.WmtsLayerInfo sub-Layer. More information is available if you ' care to loop through the IEnumerable(Of String) objects. If oneWMTSLayerInfo.Formats IsNot Nothing Then TextBox_Formats.Text = oneWMTSLayerInfo.Formats.Count.ToString End If
' Display the Identifier of the WmtsLayer.WmtsLayerInfo sub-Layer. If oneWMTSLayerInfo.Identifier IsNot Nothing Then TextBox_Identifier.Text = oneWMTSLayerInfo.Identifier End If
' Display the Styles of the WmtsLayer.WmtsLayerInfo sub-Layer. More information is available if you ' care to loop through the IEnumerable(Of String) objects. If oneWMTSLayerInfo.Styles IsNot Nothing Then TextBox_Styles.Text = oneWMTSLayerInfo.Styles.Count.ToString End If
' Display the TileMatrixSets of the WmtsLayer.WmtsLayerInfo sub-Layer. More information is available if you ' care to loop through the IEnumerable(Of String) objects. If oneWMTSLayerInfo.TileMatrixSets IsNot Nothing Then TextBox_TileMatrixSets.Text = oneWMTSLayerInfo.TileMatrixSets.Count.ToString End If
' Display the Title of the WmtsLayer.WmtsLayerInfo sub-Layer. If oneWMTSLayerInfo.Title IsNot Nothing Then TextBox_Title2.Text = oneWMTSLayerInfo.Title End If
End If Next End If
End Sub
Private Sub WmtsLayer_InitializationFailed(ByVal sender As System.Object, ByVal e As System.EventArgs)
' This function displays any error information of the WmtsLayer fails to load.
Dim aLayer As ESRI.ArcGIS.Client.Layer = sender MessageBox.Show(aLayer.InitializationFailure.Message)
End Sub

member.name: M:Geocortex.Essentials.Client.Ows.WmtsLayer.GetTileUrl(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns a URL to the specific tile in a WmtsLayer.

remarks.para: A WmtsLayer is made up of multiple tiles (or images) that are automatically put together in a mosaic for display in a Map Control. The tiles are pre-generated on a WMTS server and can be accessed individually via a URL. In order to access the URL for a specific tile it is required to know the Level, Row, and Column information. As of ArcGIS Server version 10.1, serving WMTS layers as a native REST service is supported.

It is possible to obtain the complete list of various Level, Row, and Column input parameter values that can be used by the GetTileUrl Method by interrogating the XML information returned from a GetCapabilities request in the address bar of a web browser but this is tedious (see the WmtsLayer documentation for a few examples of using the GetCapabilities request). A programmatic way to determine the various Level, Row, and Column information can be obtained by writing some code-behind logic in the WmtsLayer.TileLoading Event (see the code example in this document).
If the ProxyUrl Property has been set to create the WmtsLayer, then the output return string of the GetTileUrl Method will have that ProxyUrl value inserted at the beginning.
Note: Using Methods are only available in code-behind. You cannot use a Method via XAML.

example.para: After the WmtsLayer loads in the Map Control, the ListBox will be populated with all the combinations of 'Level, Row, and Column' tiles that make up the initial extent of the WmtsLayer image service. Click on any of the combinations in the Listbox and that particular tile will be displayed in an Image Control as well as the Url for that image.
The XAML code in this example is used in conjunction with the code-behind (C# or VB.NET) to demonstrate the functionality.
The following screen shot corresponds to the code example in this page.

img.alt: Displaying individual tile images and their URL values for a WmtsLayer.

example.code:
<Grid x:Name="LayoutRoot" >
<!-- Provide the instructions on how to use the sample code. --> <TextBlock Height="78" HorizontalAlignment="Left" Name="TextBlock1" VerticalAlignment="Top" Width="640" TextWrapping="Wrap" Text="After the WmtsLayer loads in the Map Control, the ListBox will be populated with all the combinations of 'Level, Row, and Column' tiles that make up the initial extent of the WmtsLayer image service. Click on any of the combinations in the Listbox and that particular tile will be displayed in an Image Control as well as the Url for that image." />
<!-- The Map Control. --> <sdk:Label Height="28" HorizontalAlignment="Left" Margin="33,160,0,0" Name="Label_MapControl" VerticalAlignment="Top" Width="120" Content="Map Control:"/> <esri:Map Background="White" HorizontalAlignment="Left" Margin="32,180,0,0" Name="Map1" VerticalAlignment="Top" WrapAround="True" Height="320" Width="600"> <esri:Map.Layers> <esri:LayerCollection>
<!-- Add a WmtsLayer. The use of a ProxyUrl is needed in addition to the regular Url property because the WMTS service is not hosted on a site that provides a cross domain policy file (clientaccesspolicy.xml or crossdomain.xml). The InitializationFailed Event is used to notify the user in case the WMTS service is down. The TileLoading Event provides details about individual tiles in the WMTS service that is necessary to get the input parameters (Level, Row, Column) of the WmtsLayer.GetTileUrl Method. --> <esri:WmtsLayer ID="WMTS1" ServiceMode="KVP" Layer="usa:states" Url="http://v2.suite.opengeo.org/geoserver/gwc/service/wmts" ProxyUrl="http://serverapps.esri.com/SilverlightDemos/ProxyPage/proxy.ashx" InitializationFailed="WmtsLayer_InitializationFailed" TileLoading="WmtsLayer_TileLoading"/> </esri:LayerCollection> </esri:Map.Layers> </esri:Map>
<!-- ListBox results. --> <sdk:Label Height="28" HorizontalAlignment="Left" Margin="33,512,0,0" Name="Label_ListBox1" VerticalAlignment="Top" Width="194" Content="ListBox Control:"/> <ListBox Height="93" HorizontalAlignment="Left" Margin="33,526,0,0" Name="ListBox1" VerticalAlignment="Top" Width="194" SelectionChanged="ListBox1_SelectionChanged"/>
<!-- TiledLayer.TileLoadEventsArgs. Level, Row, and Column. --> <sdk:Label Height="28" HorizontalAlignment="Left" Margin="239,510,0,0" Name="Label_TileLoadEventArgs" VerticalAlignment="Top" Width="120" Content="TileLoadEventArgs:"/> <sdk:Label Height="28" HorizontalAlignment="Left" Margin="239,542,0,0" Name="Label_Level" VerticalAlignment="Top" Width="48" Content="Level:"/> <TextBox Height="23" HorizontalAlignment="Left" Margin="293,536,0,0" Name="TextBox_Level" VerticalAlignment="Top" Width="52" /> <sdk:Label HorizontalAlignment="Left" Margin="239,564,0,208" Name="Label_Row" Width="48" Content="Row:"/> <TextBox Height="23" HorizontalAlignment="Left" Margin="293,566,0,0" Name="TextBox_Row" VerticalAlignment="Top" Width="51" /> <sdk:Label Height="28" HorizontalAlignment="Left" Margin="239,602,0,0" Name="Label_Column" VerticalAlignment="Top" Width="48" Content="Column:" /> <TextBox Height="23" HorizontalAlignment="Left" Margin="293,596,0,0" Name="TextBox_Column" VerticalAlignment="Top" Width="52" />
<!-- WmtsLayer.GetTileUrl results. --> <sdk:Label Height="28" HorizontalAlignment="Left" Margin="32,631,0,0" Name="Label_GetTileUrl" VerticalAlignment="Top" Width="344" Content="WmtsLayer.GetTileUrl:"/> <TextBox Height="124" HorizontalAlignment="Left" Margin="32,648,0,0" Name="TextBox_GetTileUrl" VerticalAlignment="Top" Width="344" TextWrapping="Wrap"/>
<!-- Image Control results. --> <sdk:Label Height="28" HorizontalAlignment="Left" Margin="384,508,0,0" Name="Label_ImageControl1" VerticalAlignment="Top" Width="198" Content="Image Control:"/> <Image Height="250" HorizontalAlignment="Left" Margin="382,522,0,0" Name="Image1" Stretch="Fill" VerticalAlignment="Top" Width="250" />
</Grid>

Private Sub WmtsLayer_InitializationFailed(ByVal sender As System.Object, ByVal e As System.EventArgs)
' Notify the user if there is a failure with the WMTS service. Dim aLayer As ESRI.ArcGIS.Client.Layer = sender MessageBox.Show(aLayer.InitializationFailure.Message)
End Sub
Private Sub WmtsLayer_TileLoading(ByVal sender As System.Object, ByVal e As ESRI.ArcGIS.Client.TiledLayer.TileLoadEventArgs)
' This Event will fire for each tile that is loaded in the Map Control. For instance, if it takes 4 tiled images ' to render the Map Control completely, then this Event will fire 4 times. As you Zoom In or Pan around to other ' geographic areas in the Map, this Event will continue to fire until all of the tiles have been processed.
' The e argument of the Event returns a TileLoadEventArgs object. Dim myTileLoadEventArgs As ESRI.ArcGIS.Client.TiledLayer.TileLoadEventArgs = e
' Get the Tile's Level, Row, and Column Properties Dim myLevel As Integer = myTileLoadEventArgs.Level Dim myRow As Integer = myTileLoadEventArgs.Row Dim myColumn As Integer = myTileLoadEventArgs.Column
' Generate a string that is comma delimited with the Level, Row, and Column values and add them to a Listbox. Dim myString As String = myLevel.ToString + "," + myRow.ToString + "," + myColumn.ToString
' Do not add any duplicates. If Not ListBox1.Items.Contains(myString) Then ListBox1.Items.Add(myString) End If
End Sub
Private Sub ListBox1_SelectionChanged(ByVal sender As System.Object, ByVal e As System.Windows.Controls.SelectionChangedEventArgs)
' Get the SelectedItem from the Listbox and parse out the Level, Row, and Column arguments necessary to ' obtain the Url for a specific tile. Dim theConcatenatedString As String = ListBox1.SelectedItem Dim theParts As String() = Split(theConcatenatedString, ",") Dim theLevel As Integer = CInt(theParts(0)) Dim theRow As Integer = CInt(theParts(1)) Dim theColumn As Integer = CInt(theParts(2))
' Update the Level, Row, and Column information in the TextBoxes for ease of viewing. TextBox_Level.Text = theLevel.ToString TextBox_Row.Text = theRow.ToString TextBox_Column.Text = theColumn.ToString
' Get the WmtsLayer. Dim theWMTSLayer As ESRI.ArcGIS.Client.Toolkit.DataSources.WmtsLayer = Map1.Layers("WMTS1")
' Obtain a specific tile Url from the WmtsLayer using the three arguments for the GetTileUrl Method. Dim theGetTileUrl As String = theWMTSLayer.GetTileUrl(theLevel, theRow, theColumn) TextBox_GetTileUrl.Text = theGetTileUrl
' Only process valid restults. If theGetTileUrl IsNot Nothing Then
' Set the specific tile's Url as the Image's Source. Dim myUri As New Uri(theGetTileUrl) Image1.Source = New Imaging.BitmapImage(myUri)
End If
End Sub

member.name: P:Geocortex.Essentials.Client.Ows.WmtsLayer.Token
member.summary: Gets or sets the token for accessing a secure ArcGIS service.
member.remarks: ArcGIS Server services may be secured using token authentication. Use Services Directory to determine if a service requires a token to be used. A token is an encrypted string generated by a token service on the same ArcGIS Server site and the secured service. The token service can be accessed in a browser via the Get Token link in Services Explorer or by navigating to the main token service page (e.g. http://www.example.com/ArcGIS/tokens/gettoken.html). See the discussion topic on secure services for more info.

member.name: P:Geocortex.Essentials.Client.Ows.WmtsLayer.ProxyUrl
member.summary: Optional. Gets or sets the URL to a proxy service that brokers Web requests between the Silverlight client and a WMTS service. Use a proxy service when the WMTS service is not hosted on a site that provides a cross domain policy file (clientaccesspolicy.xml or crossdomain.xml). You can also use a proxy to convert png images to a bit-depth that supports transparency in Silverlight.

member.name: P:Geocortex.Essentials.Client.Ows.WmtsLayer.ServiceMode
member.summary: Gets or sets the service mode i.e. "KVP" or "RESTful". By default, it's "RESTful".
member.remarks: If the mode doesn't match the service, it won't create the WMTS layer successfully.

member.name: P:Geocortex.Essentials.Client.Ows.WmtsLayer.Version

member.name: P:Geocortex.Essentials.Client.Ows.WmtsLayer.SkipGetCapabilities
member.summary: Optional. Gets or sets a value indicating whether to skip a request to get capabilities. Default value is false. Set SkipGetCapabilities if the site hosting the WMTS service does not provide a cross domain policy file and you do not have a proxy page. In this case, you must set the WMTS service version. If true, the initial and full extent of the WMTS Silverlight layer will not be defined.

member.name: M:Geocortex.Essentials.Client.Utilities.DynamicElement.TryGetMember(System.Dynamic.GetMemberBinder,System.Object@)
member.summary: Provides the implementation for operations that get member values. Classes derived from the System.Dynamic.DynamicObject class can override this method to specify dynamic behavior for operations such as getting a value for a property.
member.param: Provides information about the object that called the dynamic operation. The binder.Name property provides the name of the member on which the dynamic operation is performed. For example, for the Console.WriteLine(sampleObject.SampleProperty) statement, where sampleObject is an instance of the class derived from the System.Dynamic.DynamicObject class, binder.Name returns "SampleProperty". The binder.IgnoreCase property specifies whether the member name is case-sensitive.
The result of the get operation. For example, if the method is called for a property, you can assign the property value to result.
member.returns: true if the operation is successful; otherwise, false. If this method returns false, the run-time binder of the language determines the behavior. (In most cases, a run-time exception is thrown.)

member.name: M:Geocortex.Essentials.Client.Utilities.DynamicElement.TrySetMember(System.Dynamic.SetMemberBinder,System.Object)
member.summary: Provides the implementation for operations that set member values. Classes derived from the System.Dynamic.DynamicObject class can override this method to specify dynamic behavior for operations such as setting a value for a property.
member.param: Provides information about the object that called the dynamic operation. The binder.Name property provides the name of the member to which the value is being assigned. For example, for the statement sampleObject.SampleProperty = "Test", where sampleObject is an instance of the class derived from the System.Dynamic.DynamicObject class, binder.Name returns "SampleProperty". The binder.IgnoreCase property specifies whether the member name is case-sensitive.

The value to set to the member. For example, for sampleObject.SampleProperty = "Test", where sampleObject is an instance of the class derived from the System.Dynamic.DynamicObject class, the value is "Test".
member.returns: true if the operation is successful; otherwise, false. If this method returns false, the run-time binder of the language determines the behavior. (In most cases, a language-specific run-time exception is thrown.)

member.name: M:Geocortex.Essentials.Client.Utilities.DynamicElement.TryGetIndex(System.Dynamic.GetIndexBinder,System.Object[],System.Object@)
member.summary: Provides the implementation for operations that get a value by index. Classes derived from the System.Dynamic.DynamicObject class can override this method to specify dynamic behavior for indexing operations.
member.param: The indexes that are used in the operation. For example, for the sampleObject[3] operation in C# (sampleObject(3) in Visual Basic), where sampleObject is derived from the DynamicObject class, indexes[0] is equal to 3.
The result of the index operation.
member.returns: true if the operation is successful; otherwise, false. If this method returns false, the run-time binder of the language determines the behavior. (In most cases, a run-time exception is thrown.)

member.name: M:Geocortex.Essentials.Client.Utilities.DynamicElement.TrySetIndex(System.Dynamic.SetIndexBinder,System.Object[],System.Object)
member.summary: Provides the implementation for operations that set a value by index. Classes derived from the System.Dynamic.DynamicObject class can override this method to specify dynamic behavior for operations that access objects by a specified index.
member.param: The indexes that are used in the operation. For example, for the sampleObject[3] = 10 operation in C# (sampleObject(3) = 10 in Visual Basic), where sampleObject is derived from the System.Dynamic.DynamicObject class, indexes[0] is equal to 3.

The value to set to the object that has the specified index. For example, for the sampleObject[3] = 10 operation in C# (sampleObject(3) = 10 in Visual Basic), where sampleObject is derived from the System.Dynamic.DynamicObject class, value is equal to 10.
member.returns: true if the operation is successful; otherwise, false. If this method returns false, the run-time binder of the language determines the behavior. (In most cases, a language-specific run-time exception is thrown.

member.name: M:Geocortex.Essentials.Client.Utilities.DynamicElement.TryConvert(System.Dynamic.ConvertBinder,System.Object@)
member.summary: Provides implementation for type conversion operations. Classes derived from the System.Dynamic.DynamicObject class can override this method to specify dynamic behavior for operations that convert an object from one type to another.
member.param: Provides information about the conversion operation. The binder.Type property provides the type to which the object must be converted. For example, for the statement (String)sampleObject in C# (CType(sampleObject, Type) in Visual Basic), where sampleObject is an instance of the class derived from the System.Dynamic.DynamicObject class, binder.Type returns the System.String type. The binder.Explicit property provides information about the kind of conversion that occurs. It returns true for explicit conversion and false for implicit conversion.
The result of the type conversion operation.
member.returns: true if the operation is successful; otherwise, false. If this method returns false, the run-time binder of the language determines the behavior. (In most cases, a language-specific run-time exception is thrown.)

member.summary: Gets the URL. Override from DynamicMapServiceLayer
member.remarks: The Map has a private method loadLayerInView which calls Layer.Draw. The DynamicMapServiceLayer abstract class overrides the Draw method and calls DynamicMapServiceLayer.GetUrl which must be implemented in a subclass. The last parameter is the OnUrlComplete delegate, which is used to pass the appropriate values (url, width, height, envelope) to the private DynamicMapServiceLayer.getUrlComplete method.

member.summary: Gets or sets the image format being used by the service.
member.remarks: The image format must be a supported MimeType name, supported by the service and the framework.

member.summary: Gets a collection of image formats supported by the WMS service.
member.remarks: This property is only set after layer initialization completes and is false.

member.name: P:Geocortex.Essentials.Client.Ows.WmsLayer.Layers
member.summary: Required. Gets or sets the unique layer ids in a WMS service. Each id is a string value. At least one layer id must be defined.
member.value: A string array of layer ids.

member.name: P:Geocortex.Essentials.Client.Ows.WmsLayer.ProxyUrl
member.summary: Optional. Gets or sets the URL to a proxy service that brokers Web requests between the Silverlight client and a WMS service. Use a proxy service when the WMS service is not hosted on a site that provides a cross domain policy file (clientaccesspolicy.xml or crossdomain.xml). You can also use a proxy to convert png images to a bit-depth that supports transparency in Silverlight.

member.name: P:Geocortex.Essentials.Client.Ows.WmsLayer.Version
member.summary: Optional. Gets or sets the WMS version. If SkipGetCapabilities property is set to true, this value determines version requested. If SkipGetCapabilities is false, this value determines version to retrieve. If no value specified, default value returned from the site will be used.

member.name: P:Geocortex.Essentials.Client.Ows.WmsLayer.SkipGetCapabilities
member.summary: Optional. Gets or sets a value indicating whether to skip a request to get capabilities. Default value is false. Set SkipGetCapabilities if the site hosting the WMS service does not provide a cross domain policy file and you do not have a proxy page. In this case, you must set the WMS service version. If true, the initial and full extent of the WMS Silverlight layer will not be defined.

member.name: P:Geocortex.Essentials.Client.Ows.WmsLayer.ProxyImageRequests
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether image requests should be proxied, if using a proxy.

member.name: T:Geocortex.Forms.Client.Html.FormattingContext
member.summary: The FormattingContext is used to keep track of formatting/styling for an individual HTML element, as well as for all of its parent nodes. You can for instance, try to get the foreground color from this specific context, and if it's not found, it will bubble up the FormattingContext tree (through the Parent property) until it finds a matching attribute. This is well suited to html styling, whereby HTML elements can inherit styling from their parents.

member.name: T:Geocortex.Essentials.Client.LayerTheme
member.summary: Represents a set of layers which are grouped together in a meaningful way for a certain use case. There will typically be multiple layer themes in a site which the end user can toggle between, effectively swapping out the list of layers with the new list of layers as configured in the selected layer theme. The theme allows for the inclusion/exclusion of layers, and for each layer that is included in the theme, the visibility can be specified.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.param: The ID of the layer theme.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: Rest object received from a Rest request.
The ID of the layer theme.
Simple object created from the json representation.

member.summary: Configure the from a RestLayerTheme.
member.param: Simple object created from the json representation.

member.name: M:Geocortex.Essentials.Client.LayerTheme.ApplyToMap
member.summary: Applies the theme settings to the map. This method iterates through all the layers in the map and adjusts their visibility and other settings depending on if the layer is in the theme or not. By design, this method will reapply the theme even if the theme has already been applied. It also ensures that the LayerThemesInfo.Active theme is set to this theme. In order to call this method, the LayerThemesInfo, and LayerThemesInfo.Map properties must be specified in order for this method to get access to the map.
member.exception: If either the LayerThemesInfo or LayerThemesInfo.Map properties are null.

member.summary: Invokes the PropertyChanged event.

member.summary: Gets or sets the display name of the theme, that can be shown to the end user.

member.summary: Gets or sets the .

member.name: P:Geocortex.Essentials.Client.LayerTheme.IsDefaultTheme
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether this is the default theme. This is determined based on whether or not the ID is null. If the ID is null, it is taken to be the default theme. If it is not null, it is not the default theme. The default theme specifies that all layers are included, and the visibilities are as configured in the site map.
member.value: true if this is the default theme; otherwise, false.

member.name: P:Geocortex.Essentials.Client.LayerThemesInfo.Active
member.summary: Gets or sets the current theme. The getter is a simple accessor, but setting this property will both set the property and apply the theme to the map. To apply the theme you may also use, LayerTheme.ApplyToMap() and it will have almost the exact same effect. The difference is that when you set this property, it will only apply the theme if the theme is different than the previous value of this property.

member.name: T:Geocortex.Forms.Client.OrientedSize
member.summary: The OrientedSize structure is used to abstract the growth direction from the layout algorithms of WrapPanel. When the growth direction is oriented horizontally (ex: the next element is arranged on the side of the previous element), then the Width grows directly with the placement of elements and Height grows indirectly with the size of the largest element in the row. When the orientation is reversed, so is the directional growth with respect to Width and Height.

member.summary: The size dimension that grows indirectly with the maximum value of the layout row or column.

member.name: T:Geocortex.Essentials.Client.GeoRss.GeoRssLayer
member.summary: GeoRSS Layer.

remarks.para: Only GeoRSS-simple feeds are supported. Geometries are returned in Geographic WGS84. If you are displaying the feed on top of a map in a different projection, they must be reprojected manually when the graphics collection gets features added.
The graphic will not have a symbol associated with them. You should specify a renderer on this layer, or manually assign symbols to the graphics when the graphics collection gets features added.
The following attributes will be associated with each graphic:
Optionally, if the item is using any of the simple-georss extensions, these will also be included:
The Graphic's property will be set to a time instance matching the PublishDate.

member.name: T:Geocortex.Forms.Client.Items.IDataItems
member.summary: Interface for FormItem that contain a collection of DataItem such as ComboBoxFormItem.
member.remarks: 1) If DataItems are added directly to the Form Item when designing a from, these items will be displayed through binding on the control. 2) If collections of DataItems (InputData) are passed in to the form definition, they will be added to the DataItems (added, not replacing). Data binding should take care of showing those. 3) If a query has been defined on the form item, it will be performed. The data coming back will replace any data already set in 1) or 2) (by assigning a new collection to ItemSource on the actual control).

member.summary: Gets the data items.

member.summary: Provides some useful geography utility methods.

member.name: F:Geocortex.Essentials.Client.Utilities.GeographyUtilities.WGS84
member.summary: The well known ID (wkid) for WGS 84 - 4326.

member.name: M:Geocortex.Essentials.Client.Utilities.GeographyUtilities.UtmCellHemisphereForLatLon(System.Tuple{System.Int32,System.Char})
member.summary: Returns the hemisphere of a UTM cell tuple.
member.param: A tuple representing a UTM cell.
member.returns: The hemisphere of the UTM cell, N or S.

member.name: M:Geocortex.Essentials.Client.Utilities.GeographyUtilities.UtmCellForLatLon(System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Calculates a UTM cell given a position in WGS84 latitude/longitude.
member.param: The latitude of the position in question.
The longitude of the position in question.
member.returns: An integer and a character that together represent the UTM cell.
member.remarks: The character returned represents the latitude cell, and not the hemisphere.

member.name: M:Geocortex.Essentials.Client.Utilities.GeographyUtilities.SpatialReferenceForUtmCell(System.Tuple{System.Int32,System.Char})
member.summary: Returns a spatial reference for a given UTM cell (WGS84)
member.param: A tuple representing the UTM cell
member.returns: A SpatialReference for the given UTM cell.

member.name: M:Geocortex.Essentials.Client.Utilities.GeographyUtilities.IsWebMercatorWkid(System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns true if the given WKID is known to be for Web Mercator.
member.returns: True if the given WKID represents Web Mercator.

member.name: M:Geocortex.Essentials.Client.Utilities.GeographyUtilities.IsWgs84Wkid(System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns true if the given WKID is for the WGS 84 coordinate system (not just the datum).
member.returns: True if the given WKID represents WGS84.

member.name: M:Geocortex.Essentials.Client.Utilities.GeographyUtilities.IsGeographicWkid(System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns true if the given WKID represents a geographic coordinate system.
member.returns: True if the given WKID represents a geographic coordinate system.

member.summary: Converts a decimal coordinate to DMS components.
member.param: The X or Y coordinate to convert.
member.returns: A tuple with degrees, minutes, seconds.

member.summary: Converts a decimal coordinate to DMS components, keeping the fractional part of the seconds.
member.param: The X or Y coordinate to convert.
member.returns: A tuple with degrees, minutes, seconds.

member.name: M:Geocortex.Essentials.Client.Utilities.GeographyUtilities.DDToDdm(System.Double)
member.summary: Converts a decimal degrees (DD) coordinate to degrees decimal minutes (DDM) components.

member.summary: Converts a DMS coordinate string to a decimal.

member.name: T:Geocortex.Essentials.Client.Tasks.FeatureExtensions
member.summary: GeometryExtentsions is a static class that provides a number of extension methods that can be applied to various ESRI objects. For example, using it, you can compare two envelopes, two sets of attributes, a map point or a polygon. The primary user of GeometryExtensions is our GeocortexFeature, although other uses may wish to use these methods as well.

Extension method to resolve the data links (if any) on an ensure feature set. Only data links with the Visible property set to true will be resolved. Note: Data link can be found on a Geocortex layer object and as such, a layer associated with the feature set is a prerequisite. If this method is called with no layer, no data linking will occur.
member.param: user-provided state to be passed along with completed or failed callbacks

member.summary: Extension method to resolve the data links (if any) on an ensure feature set. Note: Data link can be found on a Geocortex layer object and as such, a layer associated with the feature set is a prerequisite. If this method is called with no layer, no data linking will occur.
member.param: If true, will only resolve data links where the Visible property is true; otherwise, resolve all data links.
user-provided state to be passed along with completed or failed callbacks

member.name: M:Geocortex.Essentials.Client.Tasks.FeatureSetExtensions.GetFeatureSetPage(Geocortex.Essentials.Client.Tasks.FeatureSet,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Retrieve the given page of features from the given featureset

Resolve related records asynchronously. The idea is to create a feature layer (but don't add it to the map) in order to determine if the given layer has relationships. If it does, find the related records for each feature in question. The ESRI silverlight API has a nice method that allows us to do this once, provided we know the object ids of the features in question.
member.param: User state passed into this method to be passed out again when resolution completes
Event fired when related records are resolved
Event fired when we fail to resolve related records

member.name: T:Geocortex.Essentials.Client.DataLink
member.summary: Represents a DataLink as defined by a Layer.

remarks.para: A data link is a data relation set between spatial attributes and tabular data from a foreign data source, such as. SQL, Oracle or Excel.

For example, suppose your map has a LandParcel layer with a ZIPCODE attribute, and you have an Excel spreadsheet that contains tax credit information sorted by zip code. By passing a zip code to the PerformDataLinking method, you can extract the tax credit information for that zip code from the spreadsheet.

member.summary: Performs the data linking operation using a feature set containing the attributes required during the operation. This is an asynchronous method; you may provide delegates for completion or error information.
member.param: An ESRI.ArcGIS.Client.Tasks.FeatureSet that contains the attributes defined in the parameters. The method uses only the required attributes and ignores any other attributes in the feature set.
The delegate that will be called when the operation has completed, even if an error occurs.
The delegate that will be called if an error occurs during the operation.
member.exception: If the result of the operation cannot be serialized, a SerializationException will be thrown.

member.name: M:Geocortex.Essentials.Client.DistanceUnit.ConvertTo(Geocortex.Essentials.Client.DistanceUnit,System.Double)
member.summary: Converts the distance from the current unit to the target unit. For example if this DistanceUnit is Kilometers, the targetUnit is Meters, and the distance is 1.5, the result would be 1500.0.
member.param: The target unit to conver the distance to.
member.exception: If attempting to convert to a target unit where the "IsLinear" property of the target DistanceUnit does not match this DistanceUnit. In other words, if attempting to convert from a linear unit to an angular unit or vice versa.

member.name: M:Geocortex.Essentials.Client.DistanceUnit.ConvertAtLatitude(Geocortex.Essentials.Client.DistanceUnit,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Converts to the specified target unit, when this unit and the target unit do not have matching "IsLinearUnit" properties (i.,e, one is linear and the other is angular).
member.param: The degrees latitude at which to perform the conversion.
member.returns: The horizontal distance at the given degrees latitude.
member.remarks: All conversions (falsely) assume that the earth is a sphere with a radius of ~3,963.1676 miles.
member.exception: If is greater than 90 or less than -90.

member.param: The object to compare with the current object.

member.name: T:Geocortex.Essentials.Client.Report
member.summary: Represents a report for a specific Layer.

remarks.para: A report displays information about some of the features of a specific Layer. When a report is generated, an ESRI.ArcGIS.Client.Tasks.Query must be provided that indicates which features to include in the report.
Report generation requires a report template created by the Geocortex Report Designer and stored on the server.

member.name: M:Geocortex.Essentials.Client.Report.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the Report class.
member.param: The URL to the REST endpoint of the Report.

member.name: M:Geocortex.Essentials.Client.Report.Run(ESRI.ArcGIS.Client.Tasks.Query,Geocortex.Essentials.Client.ReportParameters,Geocortex.Essentials.Client.Report.OnRunReportComplete,Geocortex.Essentials.Client.AsynchronousOperationFailed)

summary.para: Run the report using an ESRI.ArcGIS.Client.Tasks.Query and the ReportParameters.
This is an asynchronous method; you may provide delegates for completion or error information.

member.param: The ESRI Query to use to select features from the Layer to report on.
The delegate that will be called when the report has finished running (even if an error occurs).
The delegate that will be called if an error occurs.
member.remarks: You cannot call the Run method from the complete or error delegates. IsRunning will still be false.

member.name: T:Geocortex.Client.JsonHelper
member.summary: This class encodes and decodes JsonHelper strings. Spec. details, see http://www.json.org/ JsonHelper uses Arrays and Objects. These correspond here to the datatypes ArrayList and Hashtable. All numbers are parsed to doubles.
member.remarks: http://techblog.procurios.nl/k/618/news/view/14605/14863/How-do-I-write-my-own-parser-for-JsonHelper.html This code was taken from a blog article written by Patrick van Bergen. In his post he makes the following statement: Yes, the link to the source code is to the top of the article The code may be used without cost or obligation. I made some simple modification to make it work in Silverlight. I modified Hashtables to Dictionary(string, object) and ArrayList to List(object). I also changed the Char.ConvertFromUtf32 to IConvertible

member.name: T:Geocortex.Essentials.Client.Layer
member.summary: Represents a layer configured in a MapService.

remarks.para: A Geocortex layer should not be confused with an ArcGISDynamicMapServiceLayer or an ArcGISTiledMapServiceLayer. It is more akin to the ESRI.ArcGIS.Client.LayerInfo class.

The layer provides additional configuration beyond what is defined in an ArcGIS server map service sub layer. For example, the layer might have reports and datalinks defined. Also, the layer's configuration overrides the default visibility of the layer.
In order for sub-layers of ESRI.ArcGIS.Client.ArcGISDynamicMapServiceLayer to appear on the map, they must be explicitly defined in the layer collection of the MapService.

member.name: M:Geocortex.Essentials.Client.Layer.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the Layer class.
member.param: The URL to the REST endpoint of the Layer.
member.remarks: If a Layer object is created using this public constructor (versus being created automatically from a MapService object), it will always return false for the IsVisible property and the SetVisibility method will have no effect.

member.summary: Duplicates the current layer and adds the duplicate below itself in the MapService. This function is asynchronous so you must use the callback to get notify when it is terminated.
member.param: Indicates that new layer should be inserted before the source.
The renderer to use for the new layer.
The name for the new layer.
The display name for the new layer.
A callback action that will be fired when the layer had been duplicated.

member.summary: Sets the visibility of the Layer. If the Layer is part of a tiled (or image) service, then the whole MapService visibility is set.
member.param: The visibility to set (true: visible, false: hidden).

member.name: M:Geocortex.Essentials.Client.Layer.ApplyFieldConfiguration(System.Collections.Generic.IDictionary{System.String,System.Object},System.Collections.Generic.IDictionary{System.String,System.String})
member.summary:
Apply field configuration to a dictionary.
This method will remove elements whose Visible property is set to false.
If an alias for the name of a field is provided, the name (the dictionary key) will be changed.
An element which has a DisplayName configured will have its key replaced with the DisplayName value. The DisplayName overrides any field alias.
If a FormatString is defined, it is applied to the attribute's value (if the attribute exists).
member.param: A dictionary of attributes. The dictionary will be modified.
A dictionary of aliases to apply to the names of the properties.

member.name: M:Geocortex.Essentials.Client.Layer.CollectFieldAliases(System.Collections.Generic.IDictionary{System.String,System.String})
member.summary: Collects the field aliases and field display names into one dictionary.
member.returns: A new dictionary which maps field names to their aliases or display names.

member.name: M:Geocortex.Essentials.Client.Layer.ApplyFieldConfiguration(System.Collections.Generic.IDictionary{System.String,System.Object})
member.summary:
Apply field configuration to a dictionary.
This method will remove elements whose Visible property is set to false.
An element which has a DisplayName configured will have its key replaced with the DisplayName value.
If a FormatString is defined, it is applied to the attribute's value (if the attribute exists).
member.param: A dictionary of attributes. The dictionary will be modified.

member.name: M:Geocortex.Essentials.Client.Layer.ApplyFieldConfiguration(ESRI.ArcGIS.Client.Tasks.FeatureSet)
member.summary:
Apply field configuration to a ESRI.ArcGIS.Client.Tasks.FeatureSet. This method iterates over the features, modifying the attributes of each. The field aliases are applied.
This method will remove elements whose Visible property is set to false.
An element which has a DisplayName configured will have its key replaced with the DisplayName value.
If a FormatString is defined, it is applied to the attribute's value (if the attribute exists).

member.name: M:Geocortex.Essentials.Client.Layer.ApplyFieldConfiguration(Geocortex.Essentials.Client.Tasks.FeatureSet)
member.summary:
Apply field configuration to a Geocortex.Essentials.Client.Tasks.FeatureSet. This method iterates over the features of the underlying ESRI.ArcGIS.Client.Task.FeatureSet, modifying the attributes of each. The field aliases are applied.
This method will remove elements whose Visible property is set to false.
An element which has a DisplayName configured will have its key replaced with the DisplayName value.
If a FormatString is defined, it is applied to the attribute's value (if the attribute exists).

member.returns: The layer's (or source layer's) corresponding DynamicLayerInfo, or null if none is found.

member.summary: Determines whether or not all of a layer's ancestors are visible.
member.returns: True, if all of the layer's ancestors are visible (or the layer does not have any ancestors); otherwise, false.

member.name: M:Geocortex.Essentials.Client.Layer.CreateDynamicLayerInfo
member.summary: Creates a DynamicLayerInfo from the Layer.
member.remarks: This method will first attempt to create the DynamicLayerInfo from the DynamicDefinition. If that fails, it will then attempt to return a shallow copy of the SourceLayer's DynamicLayerInfo from the map service. If that fails, it will then attempt to create a DynamicLayerInfo using the SourceLayer's LayerInfo. If all else fails, it will return null.
member.returns: A DynamicLayerInfo, or null if not possible.

member.name: P:Geocortex.Essentials.Client.Layer.FeatureZoomScale
member.summary: Gets or sets the scale to display a feature at when zooming to a feature in this layer. This value is just the lower part of the scale, expressed as an integer. For example, to configure a value of 1:20,000, set this value to 20000. This property should be used for point layers, while FeatureZoomFactor should be used for polygon and polyline layers.

member.name: P:Geocortex.Essentials.Client.Layer.CurrentRenderer
member.summary: Gets the current renderer for the layer. This is only useful for Dynamic Symbolization.
member.remarks: In order for this data to be initially populated, the MapService.InitializeDynamicLayersSymbolization function must have been called once.

member.name: P:Geocortex.Essentials.Client.Layer.FeatureZoomFactor
member.summary: Gets or sets a zoom factor to use to expand the extent by when zooming to a feature. For example, if this value is set to 3, then the extent will be expanded by a factor of 3 when zooming to that feature. This property should be used for polygon and polyline layers, while FeatureZoomScale should be used for point layers.

member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the layer is either in the active layer theme, or there are no themes. This is useful because when determining if a layer should be participating in a theme, the check is normally only relevant if themes are available. By using this property instead of InActiveTheme, it covers off the case where there simply are no themes.

member.summary: The map service is rendered on the server (ArcGIS Server). This is typically the case.

member.summary: The map service is rendered on the client, such as is the case with ArcGIS FeatureLayer objects.

member.name: T:Geocortex.Essentials.Client.FailureAction
member.summary: Describes how the end user application should deal with a failed service.

member.name: F:Geocortex.Essentials.Client.FailureAction.Ignore
member.summary: Indicates that a failed service error should be ignored, and the application should function as though nothing bad happened. This sort of action should be associated with a service that has very little importance to the overall functioning of the application.

member.name: F:Geocortex.Essentials.Client.FailureAction.Warn
member.summary: Indicates that the application should warn the user when the server is down, but other than that the application should function. This sort of action should be associated with a service that has medium importance to the overall functioning of the application.

member.name: F:Geocortex.Essentials.Client.FailureAction.Error
member.summary: Indicates that the application should produce an error message, and that the user should be prevented from using the application. This sort of action should be associated with a service that has very high importance to the overall functioning of the application.

member.name: T:Geocortex.Essentials.Client.PrintTemplate
member.summary: Represents a print template as defined by a Site.

remarks.para: The map image is generated from a map extent. This extent can be the current extent of the ESRI.ArcGIS.Client.Map, the full or initial extent defined in the EssentialsMap, or a custom extent.
Generation of a printable map requires a print template created by the Geocortex Report Designer and stored on the server.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the PrintTemplate class.
member.param: The URL to the REST endpoint of the PrintTemplate.

member.summary: Prints the template using ReportParameters. This is an asynchronous method, you may provide delegates for completion or error information.
member.param: The delegate that will be called when the print has completed (even if an error occurs).
The delegate that will be called if an error occurs.
member.remarks: You cannot call the Print method from the complete or error delegates. IsPrinting will still be false.

member.name: T:Geocortex.Essentials.Client.AuthenticationControlBlockStore
member.summary: Manages a collection of authentication control blocks. The idea is that for a given root Url, there is a token associated with it. That token following the first request to the secured service. When subsequent calls are made, those requests are held until the token is received and if the token is received, the token is attached to that request.

member.summary: Finds a token associated with the given URL. A match is found if the base URL of the token (or the referrer root URL) is a prefix of and the ports match.

member.name: T:Geocortex.Essentials.Client.Site
member.summary: Represents a Geocortex Essentials site that is configured on the server and accessed using a REST endpoint.

remarks.para:
The Site class is the key class in the Geocortex Silverlight API. It is a
FrameworkElement and can participate in Silverlight layout but it has no visual component.
It is recommended that you put the Site object in a ResourceDictionary (in XAML or in code), so the Site collections (such as the PrintTemplates) can be used for data binding.

You must call the Initialize method on the Site before using it. To determine if the Site has already been initialized, check the IsInitialized property. The Site is initialized asynchronously, so you must attach an event handler to determine when the initialization has finished. You can also attach a handler to the event that will report initialization errors.
The following table describes the events associated with the asynchronous initialization.

item.description: Occurs when an asynchronous Initialize operation completes.
Occurs when an asynchronous Initialize operation ends in failure.

remarks.para: If the site is declared in the XAML code, you do not need to call the Initialize method; it will be called automatically when the element has loaded.

You should set the Map property using element binding and the name (x:Name) of the ESRI Map element. This will ensure that the ESRI map is automatically populated with the layers that are defined in the Site once the Initialize operation has completed.

member.name: M:Geocortex.Essentials.Client.Site.Facility
member.summary: Gets the facilities that are appropriate for this site.

member.name: M:Geocortex.Essentials.Client.Site.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the Site class.

member.name: M:Geocortex.Essentials.Client.Site.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the Site class.
member.param: The URL to the site's REST endpoint.

c.title: XAML Example
c.description: The following example demonstrates how to add a Site to your page. The XAML example references event handlers that must be defined in code and is not shown in the example.

example.c: <UserControl x:Class="NamedExtentsExample.Page" xmlns="http://schemas.microsoft.com/winfx/2006/xaml/presentation" xmlns:x="http://schemas.microsoft.com/winfx/2006/xaml" xmlns:esri="clr-namespace:ESRI.ArcGIS;assembly=ESRI.ArcGIS" xmlns:ess="clr-namespace:Geocortex.Essentials.Client;assembly=Geocortex.Essentials" Loaded="UserControl_Loaded"> <UserControl.Resources> <ess:Site x:Name="Site" Url="http://sampleserver1.geocortex.com/geocortex/essentials/rest/sites/CharlotteArcGISOnline" MapName="myMap" Initialized="Site_Initialized" InitializationFailed="Site_InitializationFailed" /> </UserControl.Resources> <Grid x:Name="LayoutRoot" Background="White"> <esri:Map x:Name="myMap" /> </Grid> </UserControl>

member.name: P:Geocortex.Essentials.Client.Tasks.Feature.ZoomScale
member.summary: Gets or sets the scale to display a feature at when zooming to this feature. This value is just the lower part of the scale, expressed as an integer. For example, to configure a value of 1:20,000, set this value to 20000. If this property has not been explicitly set, then it will return the value from the layer.

member.name: P:Geocortex.Essentials.Client.Tasks.Feature.ZoomFactor
member.summary: Gets or sets a zoom factor to use to expand the extent by when zooming to a feature. For example, if this value is set to 3, then the extent will be expanded by a factor of 3 when zooming to that feature. If this property has not been explicitly set, then it will return the value from the layer.

member.name: M:Geocortex.Workflow.Client.DefaultActivityDispatcher.RegisterExternalIdHandler(System.String,System.Action{Geocortex.Workflow.Client.ActivityContext})
member.summary: Registers a handler that will be called by the dispatcher if an activity with a matching external Id is encountered. This allows the workflow developer to target a specific activity within a specific workflow instead of handling it based on the more general type name. Note that a handler with a matching external Id overrides a matching type name.
member.param: The external Id that that will be handled.

member.param: The type name of the activity to handle.
